intro: Hydrolea spinosa f. vulgaris, commonly known as the common hydrolea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its spiny stems and oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Hydrolea spinosa f. vulgaris is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
